translated: As It Was Said
The One-hundred and eighty-one-fold Collection
The Second Section
With a Corrupted Mind

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Idhāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṁ puggalaṁ paduṭṭhacittaṁ evaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
analyzed: idha aha bhikkhave ekaccam puggalam paduṭṭha cittam evam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāmi
translated: “Monks, having encompassed that person’s mind with my own mind, I discern that he has a corrupted mind.

original: ‘imamhi cāyaṁ samaye puggalo kālaṁ kareyya yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye’.
analyzed: imamhi ca ayam samaye puggalo kālam kareyya yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: If at this time he were to die, he would be deposited in hell as if brought there.
Why is that?
Because his mind is corrupted.

original: Cetopadosahetu kho pana, bhikkhave, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: cetas upadosa hetu kho pana bhikkhave evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti iti
translated: It’s because of a corruption of the mind that some beings go to a bad destination, to hell, at the break-up of the body, after death.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“Having known a person here with a corrupted mind,
the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun,
explained the meaning of this

original: buddho bhikkhūna santike.🔽Imamhi cāyaṁ samaye,🔽kālaṁ kayirātha puggalo;
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhikkhūna santike  ca ayam samaye  kālam puggalaḥ
translated: in the presence of the monks.🔽If at this time a person were to die,
he would be deposited in hell.
His mind is corrupted.
As one who has taken away and hidden it,
So is one of such a kind.🔽For beings go to a bad destination
Because of a fault in their own minds.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The tenth.🔽The second sub-chapter is finished.
The summary:

original: Moho kodho atha makkho,🔽Vijjā taṇhā sekhaduve ca;
analyzed: mohaḥ kodhaḥ atha makkho  vijjā taṇhā sekhaduve ca
translated: Delusion, anger, and then contempt,🔽Knowledge, craving, and two in training,
Division, harmony, and an individual,
The sub-chapter is called “second.”
